chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Jina] 「クロノ……
english: [Jina] Crono......

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: クロノ！
english: Crono!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: クロノったら！[END]
english: Hey, Crono!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ジナ「いつまでねてるの？ いいかげん起きなさい！[END]
english: Jina: How long are you sleeping? Get up already!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ジナ「ああ、リーネの鐘があんなに 気持ちよさそうに歌ってる。[END]
english: Jina: Ahh, Leene's Bell is singing so pleasantly.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ジナ「どうせゆうべ、こうふんして ねつけなかったんでしょ？ ま、建国千年のお祭りだから 無理ないけど…… あんまり調子に乗って ハシャぎすぎるんじゃないわよ！[END]
english: Jina: I'll bet you wound up too excited to get to sleep last night, didn't you? Well, it's the National Foundation Millenial Festival, so that's only natural, but......  Don't get caught up in the moment and party too much!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ジナ「さ、いいかげん起きなさい！[END]
english: Jina: Come on, get up already!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ジナ「やっと起きたのね。 そうそう、あの、おさななじみの 発明好きな子……
english: Jina: I see you finally got up. Oh yes, your childhood friend, that girl who likes inventions......

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: アラ、ドわすれしちゃったわ。 なんていったっけ、あの子？[END]
english: Oh, it's slipped my mind. What was that girl's name?

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ジナ「そう、ルッカ！
english: Jina: That's right, Lucca!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ルッカの発明、見に行くんでしょ？[END]
english: You're going to see Lucca's invention, right?

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ジナ「あんまり、おそくならないようにね。 さ、行ってらっしゃい。[END]
english: Jina: Make sure not to be too late. Well, I'll see you later.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ジナ「あっ、そうそう。 はい、おこづかい。 お祭り楽しんでらっしゃい。
english: Jina: Oh yes, that's right! Here's your allowance! Have fun at the fair!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 200Gを手に入れた！[END]
english: Got 200G!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [System] 休みますか？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [System] Rest? Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Woman] ねえ、知ってる？　ここガルディア王国が できて、今年で1000年。現ガルディア王 つまり、今の王様だけど33代なのよ。
english: [Young Woman] Hey, did you know? It's 1000 years this year since Guardia Kingdom here was formed. The current King Guardia, our king now in other words, is the 33rd.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: で、その王様のなやみのタネは 一人娘の王女様。 なんでもすっごい、おてんばなんですって。
english: And the root of that king's worries is the princess, his only daughter. They say she's an incredible tomboy.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: たぶん今ごろは、お城のなかで 『あたしも、お祭りいきたーい！』 なんて、おおさわぎしてるんじゃ ないかしらね。[END]
english: I wonder if she isn't making a big fuss in the castle about now, something like “I wanna go to the festival too!”

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Man] あの、まいどおさわがせ娘、ルッカが 千年祭会場で、せいきの大発表をするって せんでんしてたぜ。[END]
english: [Young Man] That girl who's always causing a big fuss, Lucca, was advertising about making the announcement of the century at the Millennial Festival grounds.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Woman] 私ね、今がいちばんしあわせな時…… そんな気がするの。[END]
english: [Young Woman] Now is the happiest time for me...... That's the feeling I'm getting.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Waitress] あら、いらっしゃい。 ゆっくりしていってね。 なーんていっても、無理よね。
english: [Waitress] Ah, welcome. Take your time. Or whatever, it's overdoing it to say that.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: あ～あ、私もはやくシゴトをおわって お祭りを見にいきたいわ。[END]
english: Aaah, I wanna hurry up and finish work and go see the festival too!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Inn Keeper] おとまりは10Gです。 はい いいえ[END]
english: [Inn Keeper] It's 10G to stay here. Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Innkeeper] ではいつでもどうぞ。[END]
english: [Innkeeper] Well then, feel free any time.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Man] 千年祭には行ってきたかい？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [Young Man] Have you been to the Millennial Festival? Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: えっ？　早く行ってこいよ！！ この国ができて、今年で1000年って お祭りなんだぜ。
english: What? Hurry up and go!! The festival's since this year is the 1000th year since this kingdom was formed.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ここから北にあるリーネ広場じゃ、今ごろ いろんな店が出ていて、そりゃあもう お祭りさわぎってやつだな。[END]
english: In Leene Square, north from here, there are all sorts of shops set up, and it's festival merrymaking by now.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: すげえよな、いろんなものが売ってるし いろんなイベントもある…… まさにフェスティバル！！[END]
english: It's amazing, selling all sort of things, having all sorts of events...... Now that is a festival!!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Woman] 1ぱい、おごってもらえないかしら？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [Young Woman] Could I get you to treat me to a drink? Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Woman] ありがとう、お礼に1きょく プレゼントするわ。[END]
english: [Young Woman] Thanks, I'll play you a song to show my gratitude.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Man] 先日、地震があったのをおぼえているかい？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [Young Man] Remember there was an earthquake the other day? Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: そうか。ノンキなぼうやだな。 まあ、いいや。[END]
english: I see. Such a carefree kid. Well, never mind.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 本当に最近は地震が多いよな。 なにかよくないことが起こる 前ぶれでなきゃいいんだけどね。[END]
english: There's really been a lot of earthquakes lately. I hope it's not an omen that something bad's going to happen.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Woman] 代々、伝わっているハコです。 開けられた方ごじゆうにどうぞ。[END]
english: [Woman] The box has been passed down for generations. If you can open it, feel free to help yourself.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [System] 不思議な力で封印されている……。[END]
english: [System] It's sealed with a mysterious power......

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Poyozo Doll] リーネ広場にて出店中！[END]
english: [Poyozo Doll] Currently at a stall in Leene Square!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Woman] こんにちは。 この家の事聞きたい？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [Woman] Good day. Would you like to hear about this house? Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: この家の町長は、ぼうけん者が好きでね。 初心者にぼうけんのノウハウを 教えてくれるのよ。
english: The mayor in this house likes adventurers. He teaches beginners adventuring know-how.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: それから、この家にある宝ばこは 町長がぼうけん者のためにって 置いてあるの。 えんりょしないで持って行ってね。[END]
english: Also, the treasure boxes that are in this house, the mayor left for the sake of adventurers. Take them with you without restraint.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Woman] 武器や防具について 聞かせてあげましょうか？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [Young Woman] Shall I let you hear about weapons and armoring? Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 武器といっても、色々なものがあるのよ。 刀とか、ゆみとか、けんじゅうとかね。 けど人にはとくい、ふとくいがあって その人に合った武器しか、使えないの。
english: We call them all weapons, but there are a variety of them. Like katanas, bows, and pistols. But everyone has their strengths and weaknesses, and can't use any weapons but those suited to them.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 防具には3つのしゅるいがあるわ。 頭につけるものと、体につけるものと それからアクセサリー。
english: There are three types to armoring. The ones you put on your head, the ones you put on your body, and accessories.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 防具も自分の体に合ったものしか 装備できないのよ。
english: You can't equip armoring either except for the ones suited to your body.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: それからアクセサリーには、特別な力が あるものが多いから色々と調べてみると いいわ。
english: Next, in accessories, many of them have special special powers, so you should try checking out a variety of them.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: それと、刀は力が上がれば攻撃力も 上がるけど、ゆみやけんじゅうは チョットちがうの。
english: Also, for katanas, if your power increases, your attack power also increases, but for bows and pistols, it's a LITTLE different.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 必要なのは命中りつ、これが上がれば 強いダメージをあたえられるわ。[END]
english: What you need is hit rate; the more it increases, the more powerful damage you'll be able to inflict.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Man] この世の中には時の記憶がとどまる所が あるという。 そこでは危険にみちた場所でも 旅の記録をとる事が出来る。[END]
english: [Young Man] It's said there are places in this world where time's memory abides. There, even in places full of danger, you can take a record of your journey.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: それはレプリカさ。　もし本物を見かけたら 旅の記録を取ることをすすめるぜ。 なんせ危険な所ほど出現しやすいと いう話だからな。
english: That's a replica. If you happen to see the real thing, I recommend taking a record of your journey. Anyhow, they say they appear more easily the more dangerous the place is.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: おっと、それともう1つ！ ワールドマップでは、どこでも旅の記録を とれる、わすれないでくれ。[END]
english: Oh, one more thing! On the world map, you can take a record of your journey anywhere, don't forget.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Little Boy] メッセージが出てる間も、兄ちゃん達は 動き回れるんだぜ。 遠くはなれれば、声も聞こえなくなるよ。[END]
english: [Little Boy] You guys can move around even when there's a message up. If you get too far away, you won't be able to hear the voice.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Little Girl] メッセージやバトル中のウインドウは Yボタンで上下に、いどうするのよ。[END]
english: [Little Girl] Move messages and the in-battle window up and down with the Y button.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Old Woman] お前さん『シェルター』のことは 知っているのかい？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [Old Woman] Do you know about "Shelters"? Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 『シェルター』はセーブポイントと ワールドマップで使用できるアイテムで HPもMPも全回復するんじゃよ。 べんりじゃの～。[END]
english: "Shelters" are items you can use at save points and on the world map, and they fully recover both HP and MP. Convenient...

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Soldier] よっしゃあ、俺様が技のこうかはんいを 教えてやる。　聞くか？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [Soldier] Okay! I'll teach you about technique effect ranges. Listen? Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 戦闘時の技には、様々な こうかはんいがある。[END]
english: For techniques used during battle, there are various effect ranges.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: まずは、モンスターを中心に 広がるダメージだ。[END]
english: First, damage that spreads out centered on a monster.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: たとえば、こいつを ターゲットしていしたときは……[END]
english: For example, when this one's designated target.....

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: このハンイにいるモンスター つまりこの場合は2ヒキに ダメージをあたえる事ができる。[END]
english: You can inflict damage to the monsters in this range, that is, two monsters in this case.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: だがな、こいつを ターゲットしていすると……[END]
english: But, designate this one target and......

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: このとおり、3ビキのモンスターに ダメージをあたえられる。 うまく使いな。[END]
english: As you can see, you can inflict damage on three monsters. Use it well.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 次に、自分から直線的に ダメージをあたえる場合。[END]
english: Next, the case where you inflict damage on a line from yourself.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: これには2しゅるいのパターンがある。 1つめのパターンは……[END]
english: There are two types of patterns to this. The first pattern is......

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 自分からまっすぐのびた直線上の モンスターこの場合は3ビキ全てに ダメージをあたえる。[END]
english: You inflict damage on all monsters along a straight line from yourself, three in this case.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: この場合は直線上のどのモンスターに カーソルをもっていってももんだいない。[END]
english: In this case, no matter which monster along the line has the cursor, there's no problem.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: もう1つのパターンの場合は……[END]
english: In the case of the other pattern......

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 自分とモンスターをむすぶ直線上の 敵だけにダメージをあたえる。[END]
english: You inflict damage only on the enemies on the line between you and the monster.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: この場合は先ほどと同じく3ビキだが……[END]
english: This case, like before, is three monsters, but......

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: この場合は1ピキになるから 気をつけろ。[END]
english: In this case, it becomes one monster, so be careful.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 次はターゲットしていしたモンスターを ジクにして、ヨコ方向のモンスター全てに ダメージをあたえる。[END]
english: Next, you make the monster designated as target an axis, and damage all the monsters crosswise from it.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: この場合、ヨコならびなら……[END]
english: In this case, as long as they're in a horizontal line......

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 最後に自分を中心に ダメージをあたえるパターン。[END]
english: Finally, the pattern that inflicts damage with yourself at the center.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: まずこのように、はんい内にモンスターが いない場合は使えない。[END]
english: First, in the case where there are no monsters in range, like this, you can't use it.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: はんい内にモンスターがいれば 自分を中心としたはんい内の全ての モンスターにダメージを あたえることができる。[END]
english: If there are monsters in range, then you can inflict damage on all the monsters in the range centered on yourself.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: どのモンスターにターゲットしていしても オーケーだ。[END]
english: Whichever monster you designate target, it's okay.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ってところかな。 べんきょうになったろ？[END]
english: That's pretty much how it goes. Learned something, didn't you?

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Mayor] わしの話を聞きたいかの？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [Mayor] Want to listen to what I have to say? Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Mayor] ふむ、お前さんはそしつがありそうじゃの。 お前さんは戦いを続けていくうちに 『技』を身につける事が出来るじゃろう。
english: [Mayor] Hmm, it seems that you have potential. As you continue fighting, you should be able to learn "techniques".

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 技とは、おのれの武器をつかった とくしゅな攻撃法じゃ。 これは、おのれのたんれんでのみ身につく。 日々これ精進じゃ。[END]
english: Techniques are unique attack methods using your weapons. You will learn these only by your training. Focus on this daily.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ほっほっほっ。 熱心なわかものじゃの！ よし、わしからのプレゼントじゃ。 これで装備でもととのえるとよかろう。
english: Ho, ho, ho. Zealous youngster! All right, a present from me. I hope you use this to ready yourself with some equipment or the like.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 300Gを手に入れた！[END]
english: Got 300G!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Woman] 戦闘中に受けるダメージについて レクチャーしましょうか？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [Young Woman] Shall I lecture about the damage you take during combat? Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Woman] モンスターの攻撃には特別なダメージを あたえてくるものがあるわ……[END]
english: [Young Woman] Some monster attacks inflict special damage......

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 毒 HPが少しずつへっていくの。 このじょうたいでは 攻撃力も落ちるわ。[END]
english: Poison: Your HP gradually decreases. Your attack power also drops in this condition.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: スロウ スピードがおそくなって、次の攻撃に すばやくうつれなくなるわ。[END]
english: Slow: Your speed slows, and you can't move on to your next attacks as quickly.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: スリープ 眠ってしまって防御力が下がるの。 けど、攻撃を受けるとめざめるわ。[END]
english: Sleep: You fall sleep, and your defense drops. But take an attack and you'll wake up.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: こんらん 自分が何をしてるのか わからなくなってしまうの。 味方を攻撃したりね。　コワいわよ。[END]
english: Confusion: You don't know what you're doing any more. You'll do things like attacking allies.   Scary!

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ブラインド 回りがよく見えなくなって モンスターに攻撃をあてにくくなるわ。[END]
english: Blind: You can't see your surroundings well and have a hard time hitting monsters with attacks.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ロック いっさいの技がつかえなくなるの。[END]
english: Lock: You become unable to use any techniques.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: ストップ これは動きが止まって 何もできなくなるわ。[END]
english: Stop: This is when your movement stops and you become unable to do anything.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: これらのじょうたいの時は 防御力が落ちてダメージが大きくなるわ。
english: You defense power drops and damage increases when you're in these conditions.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 『ばんのうやく』などの体調回復アイテムで なおせるけど戦闘が終われば、アイテムを 使わなくても自然になおるのよ。[END]
english: You can cure them with status recovery items such as the "panacea", but if combat ends, you get well naturally even without using items.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 続き聞きます？ はい いいえ[END]
english: Will you listen to the continuation? Yes No

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: モンスターの攻撃を受けて、HPが0に なると戦闘不能になっちゃうわ。 もちろん『アテナの水』とかのアイテムで 復活も出来るわよ。
english: If your HP goes to 0 from taking monsters' attacks, you become incapacitated. Of course, you can revive too, with items like "Athena's water".

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: けどね、みんなが戦闘不能になった時は 時のながれのわすれ物になっちゃうの…… 気をつけてね。[END]
english: But when everyone is incapacitated, you'll be lost in the flow of time...... Be careful.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: [Young Man] LRを押し続けると戦闘から逃げる！！ こいつも大事だ。 戦術的てったいとでも言おうかな。
english: [Young Man] Keep pressing L and R and you'll run from combat!! This's important too. I guess we'll call it a strategic retreat.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: けどよ、逃げてばっかじゃ弱いままで 強くなれないから気をつけな。
english: But, look, keep running away, and you'll stay weak won't be able to get stronger, so be careful.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: それから、もう1つ。メニューの説明だ。 武器マークのヨコの数字は攻撃力。 たてマークのヨコの数字は防御力。
english: And one more thing. Menu explanation. The number next to the weapon mark is attack power. The number next to the shield mark is defense power.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 防御力は、なぐりや物理攻撃を どれだけふせぐかあらわす。
english: Defense power indicates how well you defend against hits and physical attacks.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival
japanese: 魔法をふせぐのは『まほうぼうぎょ』。 これがたとえば40だったら 敵の魔法を40パーセントふせぐ。
english: It's “magic defense” that defends against magic. If, for example, that's 40, you'll defend 40 percent against enemy magic.

chapter: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival

japanese: ならば！　ここはどこだなど ねぼけたことをいうのはやめるのだな。[END]
english: In that case! Quit asking things like where this is like you're half asleep.

japanese: なんと！　それも知らぬとは……。 もしかして、おぬし旅の者か？ ふむ。　それならばしかたがないか。[END]
english: What! To not know even that...... Could you be a traveler? Hmm. Then I guess you can't help it.

japanese: [Man] 建国のお祭り？　なに言ってんだ！ 今、それどこじゃねーだろ！！[END]
english: [Man] National foundation festival? What're you saying! Now's no time for that, is it!!

japanese: [Young Man] ゼナンにかかる橋は、魔王軍に 壊されてしまったよ。 当分、南の大陸へはわたれないって事だな。[END]
english: [Young Man] The bridge across Zenan was destroyed by Magus's army. Which means we can't cross to the southern continent for now.

japanese: [Soldier] いやもう、うれしくって！ ずっと、いなくなっていたリーネ王妃が 裏山で見つかったんですよっ！[END]
english: [Soldier] Wow, this is great! Queen Leene, who was long missing, was found in the back hills!

japanese: 今ごろは、お城に戻られて ホッとしているころだろうな。[END]
english: She's probably been returned to the castle by now, and it's about time to feel relieved.

japanese: でもリーネ王妃は、どういうわけか わけのわからない事を口走っているとか…… よっぽど、こわい思いをされたんだな。[END]
english: But I hear Queen Leene's blurting out some kind of nonsense for whatever reason...... She must have had quite a fright.

japanese: [Soldier] いやはや一時はどうなることかと……。 リーネ王妃がいなくなって 王様は何も手につかなくなるし。
english: [Soldier] Amazing what can happen in such a short time...... Queen Leene disappeared, and the King couldn't focus on anything else.

japanese: 魔王のしわざじゃないかって 兵士たちに国中を探させていたんですよ。 しかし、見つかってよかった！[END]
english: Thinking it might have been Magus's doing, he had the soldiers searching the whole kingdom. But it's a good thing she was found!

japanese: トマ「あんたもヨソ者かい？ 俺は探検家のトマってんだ。 いっぱいおごってくれるんなら いいネタをやるぜ。[END]
english: Toma: Are you an outsider too? I'm Toma the explorer. If you treat me to a drink, I'll give you some good info.

japanese: どーだい？ おごる おごらない[END]
english: How 'bout it? Treat him Don't treat him

japanese: [Toma] おやじ、酒！！[END]
english: [Toma] Old man, sake!!

japanese: トマ「こいつはすまねえな。　さて……。 リーネ様が、いなくなったって 話だが…… 俺は西のほうにできたという あの修道院があやしいと 思っているんだ。 え？　リーネ王妃はとっくに 裏山の方で見つかったって？ ふーむ……　そうだったのか……。[END]
english: Toma: Thanks for that. Now...... The story is Leene-sama went missing...... I think that abbey they say was built to the west is suspicious. Huh? You say Queen Leene was already found in the back hills? Hmmm...... So that was it......

japanese: トマ「俺は、西にたてられたという あの修道院が、ぜったいに あやしいと思っていたんだがな。[END]
english: Toma: I thought for sure that abbey they say was built in to west was suspicious.

japanese: トマ「そーかい。　俺は物ごいじゃねえ。 無理にとは言わねーよ。[END]
english: Toma: I see. I'm no beggar. I won't force you.

japanese: トマ「ちょっとすまねえな。[END]
english: Toma: 'Scuse me.

japanese: [Banta] 俺は、かじ屋のバンタ。 ガルディア王にたのまれて、王様から リーネ様への愛のあかし『リーネの鐘』を 作ってるのさ。[END]
english: [Banta] I'm the blacksmith Banta. I'm making “Leene's Bell” as requested by King Guardia, proof of the King's love for Queen Leene.

japanese: しかしよ、一時はどうなるかと思ったよ。 リーネ王妃になにかあったら、鐘だなんて 言ってられないからな。
english: But for a while, I wasn't sure what would happen. When something happened to Queen Leene, we couldn't be talking about BELLS.

japanese: 裏山で見つかった、リーネ王妃も無事 お城に戻られたというし。俺も安心して しごとに戻ったってわけよ。[END]
english: They say Queen Leene was found in the back hills and safely returned to the castle. So I'm relieved too, and back to my work.

japanese: [Young Woman] さいしょくけんびの娘をもつのが 夢なんですって。[END]
english: [Young Woman] He says it's his dream to have a daughter gifted with both intelligence and beauty.

japanese: [Man] せっかく来たんだ、見るだけじゃなくて ぜひ買っていってくれ。[END]
english: [Man] You've gone to all the trouble of coming, so don't just look, be sure and buy something.

japanese: まいど！ また来てくれよな。[END]
english: Thanks! Come again.

japanese: [Knight] そうか。　お前も武器を手にして 魔王軍と戦おうというのだな。 それはなかなかいい心がけだ。
english: [Knight] I see. You intend to take up arms and fight Magus's army too. That's quite a good attitude.

japanese: しかし武器や防具は買うだけでは ダメだぞ！ その後、装備してこそ意味があると いうものだ。[END]
english: But just buying weapons and armors won't cut it! It's only once you equip them afterwards that it means anything.

japanese: [Soldier] この橋は、魔王軍にこわされて 修理中だ。 しかし、サイラス様が戻られるまで、 我らが手で王国を死守するのだ！[END]
english: [Soldier] This bridge was destroyed by Magus's army and is under repair. However, until Cyrus-sama returns, we will protect the kingdom by our hands, unto death!

japanese: [System] モンスターがシェルターを落としていった！[END]
english: [System] The monster dropped a Shelter and left!

japanese: [Sign] この先、行き止まり。[END]
english: [Sign] A dead end is ahead.

japanese: 兵士「何者だ！[END]
english: Soldier: Who goes there!

japanese: 兵士「見かけんヤツだな。 大体なんだ、そのかっこうは？ もしや魔王軍の手先？
english: Soldier: I've never seen this guy. And what's with that getup? Maybe he works for Magus's army?

japanese: 兵士「と、こんな弱々しいヤツが 魔王軍という事もあるまい。
english: Soldier: But I doubt such a frail guy would be in Magus's army.

japanese: 兵士「さ、行った行った！ あまりウロウロしていると ひっとらえるぞ！
english: Soldier: Go on, get lost! Loiter around too long and we'll arrest you!

japanese: [Queen Leene] 「おやめなさい！[END]
english: [Queen Leene] 'Stop!

japanese: 兵士「リ、リーネ王妃様！[END]
english: Soldier: Qu, Queen Leene-sama!

japanese: 王妃「その方は私がお世話になったお方。 客人として、もてなしなさい。[END]
english: Queen: That person is one to whom I am indebted. Make him welcome, as a guest.

japanese: 兵士「しかし、こんな怪しい……[END]
english: Soldier: But, such a suspicious......

japanese: 王妃「私の命が聞けないと？[END]
english: Queen: Do you mean won't obey my orders?

japanese: 兵士「めっそうもありません！ どうぞお通りを！[END]
english: Soldier: That is surely not the case! By all means, pass!

japanese: 王妃「フフ……。[END]
english: QUEEN: Hu, hu......

japanese: [Soldier] 王妃様の客人とは知らず失礼いたしました。[END]
english: [Soldier] Pardon me, I did not know you were the Queen's guest.

japanese: [Soldier] 王妃様とお近づきになれるなんて ラッキーなヤツだな。[END]
english: [Soldier] You're a lucky guy, being able to get close to the queen.

japanese: [Soldier] この先にガルディア王21世がおわします。[END]
english: [Soldier] King Guardia the 21st is in here.

japanese: [Soldier] くれぐれも、失礼のないようにな。[END]
english: [Soldier] Make absolutely certain not to be impolite.

japanese: 王「おお、そなたか。 リーネが外で世話になったというのは。 心から礼を言うぞ！
english: King: Oh, it's you? Leene said she became indebted to you out there. I thank you from my heart!

japanese: しかし外で何があったのだ？ リーネの様子がどうもおかしいのだ。
english: But what happened out there? Leene hasn't been quite her usual self.

japanese: いつも身につけていたサンゴの かみかざりも、なくしていたようだし。 あれほど大事にしていたというに……。
english: She seems to have even lost the coral hair ornament she always wore, for one thing. For something she treasured that much......

japanese: いや、失礼。 そなたの事、騎土団長に話しておこう。 左地下の騎土団の部屋で休んでくれ。[END]
english: No, excuse me. I shall tell the Knight Captain about you. Rest in the Knights' room in the basement on the left.

japanese: 大臣「うーむ……[END]
english: Chancellor: Hmmm......

japanese: 大臣「なんじゃお前は！ え～い、向こうへ行け！[END]
english: Chancellor: What is it, you! Arrgh, get away from me!

japanese: [Knight] この先は王のお部屋。 騎土団の部屋は、ここを出て すぐに左に行った、かいだんの下だ。[END]
english: [Knight] This leads to the King's room. For the Knights' room, leave here, go left soon after, and down the stairs.

japanese: [Knight] ここだけの話だが、最近大臣の様子が どうもおかしいのだ。 城をよくぬけ出しているようだし……[END]
english: [Knight] Just between us, the chancellor's seemed really funny lately. Seems he slips out of the castle a lot......

japanese: [Knight] おかしいと言えば、リーネ王妃様のごえいの あのカエル野郎、近ごろ姿を見てないな。
english: [Knight] Speaking of funny, I haven't seen Queen Leene's guard, that frog bastard, lately.

japanese: 昔、呪いでカエルの姿にされたらしいが そんな事があるのだろうか。 もしや魔王軍のスパイだったのでは？[END]
english: I hear he was turned into a frog's form a while back by a curse, but do things like that happen? What if he was a spy for Magus's army?

japanese: [Young Woman] 大臣様がおかしくなったなんて言う人が いますが、私はそうは思いませんわ。
english: [Young Woman] There are people who say things like the Chancellor's gotten funny, but I don't think so.

japanese: 大臣様は、とても信心深くなられて 西のマノリア修道院に、まいにちのように おいのりに行かれてるんですよ。[END]
english: The Chancellor is very devout, and it seems like every day that he goes to Manorial Abbey in the west to pray.

japanese: [Knight] この先は王妃様のお部屋。 お前を通してもよいとの事だ。[END]
english: [Knight] This leads to the Queen's room. She said I may let you pass.

japanese: [Knight] 王妃様がお待ちかねだ。[END]
english: [Knight] The Queen eagerly awaits you.

japanese: [Young Woman] おや、アンタかい。 王妃様が外で世話になったってのは。 なんだかサエないね～。[END]
english: [Young Woman] Oh my, it's you? The one the Queen became indebted to outside. Doesn't seem like you've got the skill.

japanese: [Young Woman] 十数年……。 今でもおわかくていらっしゃいます。
english: [Young Woman] Ten-odd years...... She is youthful even now.

japanese: しかしもどって来られてから、さらに おわかくなられたみたい……。[END]
english: But it seems like she's become even younger since she came back......

japanese: 王妃「来ましたね。[END]
english: Queen: You came.

japanese: 王妃「はずしてちょうだい。 この者と話があるのです。[END]
english: Queen: Please remove yourselves. I have something to speak with this person about.

japanese: めし使い「かしこまりました。[END]
english: Servants: Certainly.

japanese: 王妃「さ、えんりょせず、もっと近くへ。[END]
english: Queen: Now, come closer, without reservation.

japanese: 王妃「プッ……。[END]
english: Queen: pft......

japanese: 王妃「なーんてね、来てくれたんだ クロノ！[END]
english: Queen: Just kidding! You came for me, Crono!

japanese: マール「そ、私よ！ 何だかみんな私の事リーネって言うの。[END]
english: Marle: Right, it's me! For some reason everyone calls me 'Leene'.

japanese: マール「でも、うれしかった。[END]
english: Marle: But I'm glad.

japanese: マール「ほんの少し、お祭りでいっしょ だっただけなのに、来てくれて。[END]
english: Marle: Even though we were only together for just a little while at the festival, you've come for me.

japanese: マール「クロノ……
english: Marle: Crono......

japanese: ありがと……。[END]
english: Thank you......

japanese: マール「な、何！？[END]
english: Marle: Wh, what!?

japanese: マール「！！
english: Marle: !!

japanese: な、何コレ？ 心がバラバラになってくみたい……[END]
english: Wh, what is this? It's like my heart is going to pieces......

japanese: マール「こ、こわいよ！ 私がなくなってしまうみたい……。 た、助けて、クロ……[END]
english: Marle: I, I'm scared! It's like I'm going to disappear...... He, help me, Cro......

japanese: [Young Woman] ね、リーネ王妃様、なんだか 変じゃなかった？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [Young Woman] Hey, wasn't something weird about Queen Leene? Yes No

japanese: やっぱり！　私はリーネじゃないって言うし なんとなく前とはちがうのよ。
english: I knew it! There's something different about her from before that says “I'm not Leene”.

japanese: あ！　コレないしょよ！[END]
english: Oh! Keep this between us!

japanese: そ。　なら、いいけど。[END]
english: Oh. Never mind then.

japanese: [Young Woman] あら！　もういいのかい？ ところであんた、リーネ王妃様に……[END]
english: [Young Woman] Oh my! Over already? By the way, you didn't......

japanese: 変なコトしなかったでしょうね？ はい いいえ[END]
english: ......do anything funny to Queen Leene, did you? No Yes

japanese: ホントかねえ……。[END]
english: Oh really......

japanese: おやおや、そんな事知れたら大変！ わたしゃ何も聞かなかったからね。[END]
english: Oh my goodness, it would be awful if that came to light! I didn't hear a thing.

japanese: [Knight] ……
english: [Knight] ......

japanese: まったく女というものは、いつの世も うわさ話が好きなものだな。[END]
english: Sheesh, those women love their gossip no matter when the era.

japanese: [Lucca] 「クロノ！[END]
english: [Lucca] 'Crono!

japanese: ルッカ「ハアハア……無事みたいね！ それより、あのコは？[END]
english: Lucca: haa, haa.... looks like you're safe! More importantly, what about that girl?

japanese: ルッカ「何ですって、消えたあ！？[END]
english: Lucca: What was that, she vanished!?

japanese: ルッカ「……やっぱりね。[END]
english: Lucca: ......I was afraid of that.

japanese: ルッカ「あのコが消える時、どっかで 見たかおだと思ったのよ。[END]
english: Lucca: When that girl disappeared, I thought I'd seen her face somewhere.

japanese: ルッカ「ここは、王国は王国でも ずいぶんと昔の王国みたいね。[END]
english: Lucca: This IS the kingdom, but it looks like the kingdom of extremely long ago.

japanese: ルッカ「あのコは、自分のご先祖様に 間違えられたってワケよ。 あの子は私達の時代でも、お姫様……[END]
english: Lucca: That means that girl was mistaken for her own ancestor. Even in our era, that girl's a princess......

japanese: ルッカ「マールディア王女なのよ！[END]
english: Lucca: She's Princess Marledia!

japanese: [Lucca] マール、つまりマールディア王女は この時代の王妃の子孫なの。[END]
english: [Lucca] Marle, that is, Princess Marledia, is a descendant of this era's queen.

japanese: この時代の王妃がさらわれた……
english: This era's queen was kidnapped......

japanese: 本当はそのあと、誰かが助けることに なっていたの。 でも歴史は変わってしまった……[END]
english: The truth is that, after that, it happened that someone saved her. But we've changed history......

japanese: つまり、マールがこの時代に現われ 王妃に間違えられたために本物の王妃の そうさくがうち切られてしまった。
english: In other words, due to Marle appearing in this era and being mistaken for the queen, the search for the real queen was discontinued.

japanese: もし王妃が殺されてしまったら…[END]
english: If the queen were to be killed...

japanese: マールの存在が消えてしまうの…… でもまだ間に合うわ！ 今からでも王妃を助け出すことができれば 歴史はもとにもどるはず！！[END]
english: Marle's existence would vanish...... But we're still in time! If we can help out the queen, even after now, history should revert to the way it was!!

japanese: ルッカ「おそらく、この時代の 王妃の身に何かあったんだわ。 だから、子孫であるあのコの存在 そのものが……[END]
english: Lucca: Probably, something happened to this era's queen. That's why the very existence of that girl, her descendant......

japanese: ルッカ「とにかく、本物の王妃の行方を 探さなきゃ！[END]
english: Lucca: In any case, we've got to search for the true queen's whereabouts!

japanese: 大臣「なぜ戻って来られた？ 一人であそこから、ぬけ出せるはずが ……[END]
english: Chancellor: How was she able to come back? She shouldn't have been able to sneak out of there on her own......

japanese: [Soldier] 休むなら下に行きな。[END]
english: [Soldier] Go below if you're resting.

japanese: [Soldier] 地下は騎土団の部屋だ。[END]
english: [Soldier] The basement is the Knights' room.

japanese: [Knight Captain] ゼナンの橋は最終防えい線。 なんとしても死守せねばならん！[END]
english: [Knight Captain] Zenan Bridge is our last line of defense. We must defend it unto death, no matter what!

japanese: お前か、王妃様を外で世話したというのは。 休むのならメイドに言ってくれ。[END]
english: So it's you they say helped the Queen outside. Talk to the maid if you're resting.

japanese: [Young Woman] お休みになられます？ はい いいえ[END]
english: [Young Woman] Will you be resting? Yes No

japanese: お目ざめはいかがです？[END]
english: How is your awakening?

japanese: [Soldier] ああ！　こんな時サイラス様が いてくれたら！[END]
english: [Soldier] Ahh! If Cyrus-sama were here for us at times like this!

japanese: お主も名前くらいは知ってるだろ？ はい いいえ[END]
english: You at least know his name too, right? Yes No

japanese: あの方さえいれば、王妃様が いなくなるなんて事もなかっただろうに……[END]
english: If only that man were here, I doubt such a thing as the Queen disappearing would have happened......

japanese: なんとサイラス様を知らぬのか！ あれほどの勇者を知らぬとは お主、どこに住んでおるのだ。[END]
english: What, you don't know Cyrus-sama?! Where do you live to not about that great a hero?

japanese: [Soldier] サイラス様は騎土団長だったお方。 いつも、王やリーネ様は自分が守ると おっしゃっておられたのに……
english: [Soldier] Cyrus-sama is the man who was the Knight Captain. He was always saying that he himself would protect the King and Leene-sama......

japanese: 十年近く前に、おともを一人つれ旅に出られ それっきりなのです。[END]
english: Close to ten years ago, he took a friend and left on a journey, and that's the last we've heard of him.

japanese: [Soldier] 昔、西の森あたりは、ヤクラという魔物が 住んでいて、誰も近寄らなかったんだ。
english: [Soldier] A monster called Yakra used to live in the forest region to the west, and no one would go near it.

japanese: だが少し前、その森の中に 修道院がたてられてからは 魔物も出なくなったのだ。 さすが神のごかご。　ありがたい事だ。[END]
english: But since the abbey was built in that forest a little while back, the monster stopped appearing. That's divine godly protection for you. It's a welcome thing.

japanese: [Soldier] いやはや、王妃様が見つかって 本当によかった。 これで戦に、せんねんできる！[END]
english: [Soldier] Oh yes, I'm so glad the Queen's been found. Now we can give the war our undivided attention!

japanese: [Wounded Soldier] うう……[END]
english: [Wounded soldier] Oohh......

japanese: [Soldier] このところ魔王軍は ナリをひそめているが、かえって不気味だ。[END]
english: [Soldier] Magus's army has been keeping quiet lately, but that's all the more eerie.

japanese: [Soldier] この下はしょくどうだ。[END]
english: [Soldier] The mess hall's below here.

japanese: [Soldier] ウロチョロして料理長に どなられんようにな。[END]
english: [Soldier] Careful you don't get yelled at by the Head Cook for loitering around.

japanese: [Soldier] ここは俺達兵士のしょくどうさ。 お前も食ってけよ。[END]
english: [Soldier] This's the mess hall for us soldiers. You eat too before you go.

japanese: [Soldier] せいつけて、魔王軍を ぶちのめしてやる！[END]
english: [Soldier] I'm gonna build up my energy and beat up Magus's army!

japanese: [Soldier] 料理長の作るメシは最高さ。 三つ星ってトコかな。[END]
english: [Soldier] The grub the Head Cook makes is the best. About three stars I guess.

japanese: [Soldier] ハ……
english: [Soldier] H......

japanese: ハラへった……[END]
english: Hungry......

japanese: おかみさん「あいよ、お待ち～！[END]
english: Wife: Here ya go, thanks for waiting!

japanese: 兵士「ヒャッホ～ッ！[END]
english: Soldier: YAHOO!

japanese: [Soldier] うまうま！[END]
english: [Soldier] Yum, yum!

japanese: [Young Woman] 食べてくなら、左のテーブルの 左上のせきにどうぞ。[END]
english: [Young Woman] If you're eating, have a seat in the top left spot at the left-hand table.

japanese: [Young Woman] あ～いそがし！　ここも戦場だね。[END]
english: [Young Woman] Aaah, busy! It's a war ground here too.

japanese: [Chef] しろうとが、ちゅうぼうに 入ってくんじゃねえ！[END]
english: [Chef] No amateurs in the kitchen!

japanese: しかし、王妃様が食べたいという クレープってな一体何だ？[END]
english: But what the heck's a crepe, what the Queen says she wants to eat?

japanese: 騎土団長「食事はまだか？[END]
english: Knight Captain: Isn't the food ready yet?

japanese: ウェイトレス「あっ騎土団長！ すみません……[END]
english: Waitress: Ah, Knight Captain! We're sorry......

japanese: 騎土団長「我々は命がけで戦ってるのだ。 早く持って来い！[END]
english: Knight Captain: We're risking our lives fighting. Hurry and bring it!

japanese: 料理長「るせえ！　命はってんのは 騎土団だけじゃねんだ！[END]
english: Head Cook: Shaddup! The Knights ain't the only ones putting their lives on the line!

japanese: 団長「フン、私はおくびょう者が作った 物など食うヒマがないが、部下達には しっかり食わせてやれよ。[END]
english: Captain: Hmph, I haven't got the time to eat anything a coward made, but let my men have a good feeding.

japanese: 料理長「てやんでえ！　言われなくたって そうすらあ！[END]
english: Head Cook: Leave off me! I'd do it without being told anyhow!

japanese: [Chef] あのヤロウ、てめえ達だけが戦ってると 思ってやがる！[END]
english: [Chef] That bastard, thinking you're the only damn ones fighting!

japanese: [Knight] 騎土団長は強くやさしいお方。 だが料理長とはいつもこれだ。[END]
english: [Knight] The Knight Captain is a strongly kind man. But it's always like this with the Head Cook.

japanese: [Knight] 騎土団長はかつての騎土団長サイラス様の 後をついでがんばっているのだ。[END]
english: [Knight] The Knight Captain is trying his best in succeeding the previous knight captain, Cyrus-sama.

japanese: [Young Woman] あの2人、兄弟なんですけど 仲が悪くて……[END]
english: [Young Woman] Those two are brothers, but they don't get along......

japanese: [Young Woman] ウチの人は殺し合いがキライでこの道を えらんだのよ。[END]
english: [Young Woman] My husband chose this path since he hates people killing each other.

japanese: [Young Woman] 何にする？ リフレッシュサラダ スタミナシチュー ハイパーまるやき[END]
english: [Young Woman] What'll it be? Refresh Salad Stamina Stew Hyper Barbecue

japanese: ちょっと待ってね。[END]
english: Just a minute.

japanese: はい、お待たせ！[END]
english: Here, thanks for waiting!

japanese: [System] MPが回復した！[END]
english: [System] MP recovered!

japanese: HPが回復した！[END]
english: HP recovered!

japanese: HP・MPが回復した！[END]
english: HP and MP recovered!

japanese: [Young Woman] 料理長はキビしいけど、いい人よ。[END]
english: [Young Woman] The head cook is strict, but he's a good person.

japanese: [Young Woman] へえ、キミがリーネ様を……[END]
english: [Young Woman] Hmm, you saved Leene-sama......?

japanese: [Nun] 私達は、世界の平和のために いのっておりますですことよ。 ウフフ……。[END]
english: [Nun] We are praying for the sake of world peace. U, hu, hu......

japanese: [Nun] 一日もはやく、私達の明日が とりもどせますように……。 あら、おいしそうなニンゲ……
english: [Nun] May we take back our tomorrow one day soon...... Oh my, tasty-looking huma......

japanese: い、いえ、なんでもありませんわ、オホホ。[END]
english: N, no, it is nothing, o, ho, ho.

japanese: [Nun] われらが、いだいなる主よ。 かよわく、力なき者達に、さばきの いかずちを……。　イヒヒヒ……。[END]
english: [Nun] O our great Lord. Upon the frail, powerless peoples, the thunder of judgment..... ee, hee, hee, hee......

japanese: [Nun] さあ、あなた達も、かわいそうな 自分達のために、いのりをささげては いかがですか。　ククク……。[END]
english: [Nun] Come now, why do you not also offer up prayers for your own poor selves? Ku, ku, ku......

japanese: ルッカ「何か見つけたの？[END]
english: Lucca: Did you find something?

japanese: ルッカ「かみかざり……？[END]
english: Lucca: A hair ornament....?

japanese: ルッカ「これ、ガルディア王家の 紋章じゃない！[END]
english: Lucca: This's the Guardia royal family's coat of arms!

japanese: ルッカ「ふ～。　ビックリした。[END]
english: Lucca: Pheeew. What a shock.

japanese: ルッカ「キャアッ！！[END]
english: Lucca: Kyaah!!

japanese: [Frog] 「最後まで気をぬくな。 勝利によいしれた時こそ スキが生じる。[END]
english: [Frog] 'Don't let your guard down until the end. It's when you're drunk with victory that your guard's wide open.

japanese: 「お前達も王妃様をお助けしに来たのか？
english: 'Did you come to aid the Queen too?

japanese: この先はヤツらの巣みたいだな。 どうだ、いっしょに行かないか？[END]
english: It looks like it's their den from here on. How's this, would you come with me?

japanese: ルッカ「あ、あなたは……！？
english: Lucca: Y, you're......!?

japanese: クロノ、知ってるでしょ。 私、カエル苦手なの……！[END]
english: Crono, you know, right? I can't handle frogs......!

japanese: [Frog] 「まあ、こんなナリをしていては 信用しろと言っても無理か……。[END]
english: [Frog] 'Well, as long as I'm like this I guess it'd be pointless telling you to trust me......

japanese: 「いいだろう、好きにしろ。 だが王妃様は俺が助け出さなきゃ ならないんだ……。[END]
english: Fine, do what you want. But I've got to help the Queen out......

japanese: ルッカ「ちょ、ちょっと……。[END]
english: Lucca: H, hold on......

japanese: ルッカ「悪いカエ……、人では なさそうね……。 うーん……。[END]
english: Lucca: You don't seem like a bad fro....... person........ Umm......

japanese: ルッカ「どうする、クロノ？ カエル男といっしょに行く いっしょに行くのはイヤ[END]
english: Lucca: What'll we do, Crono? Go with the frogman Don't want to go together

japanese: ルッカ「でも、私達だけじゃ この先ちょっと不安だわ……。[END]
english: Lucca: But I'm a bit worried about what's ahead if it's just us......

japanese: ルッカ「ガ……、ガマンして いっしょに行きましょう！[END]
english: Lucca: L...... let's put up with it, and go together!

japanese: ルッカ「あなた、お名前は？[END]
english: Lucca: What's your name?

japanese: カエル「カエルでいいぜ。[END]
english: Frog: Frog's fine.

japanese: ルッカ「ええ、それじゃ…… お手やわらかにね、カエル。[END]
english: Lucca: Yes, well then...... Don't be too hard on me, Frog.

japanese: カエル「ああ。きっと、この部屋の どこかに、かくし通路があるはずだ。 そこから奥へ行けるだろう。[END]
english: Frog: Sure. I'm positive there should be a secret passage somewhere in this room. I'll bet we can get in the back from there.

japanese: [Soldier] まさか……、人間か！？
english: [Soldier] It can't be...... you're humans!?

japanese: この奥に王妃様がとらわれているのだ。 どうか王妃様をお助けしてくれ！[END]
english: The Queen is imprisoned in the back. Please rescue the Queen!

japanese: [Soldier] この建物のどこかに、にっくき魔王を まつった部屋があるらしい……。 そこにはお宝もあるようだぜ。[END]
english: [Soldier] I heard there's a room somewhere in this building enshrining that hateful Magus...... I hear there's treasure there too.

japanese: [System] ひみつのミアンヌ・ブロマイド[heart]を 見つけた！！[END]
english: [System] Found the secret Mianu bromide[heart]!!

japanese: [Hench] おい、こいつら、人間だぜ、兄キ！[END]
english: [Hench] Hey, these guys are humans, boss!

japanese: [Hench] 俺達の、お宝ブロマイドを……！！[END]
english: [Hench] Our prized bromide......!!

japanese: [Hench] 女の子なんか、いじめちゃえ！！[END]
english: [Hench] Bully the girls!!

japanese: [Naga-ette] んん……、なんだあ？ ヒック！
english: [Naga-ette] Hmm...... what? Hic!

japanese: お前らも、はやくもとの姿にもどれや。 いつまでも人間のカッコなんか してないでよ。ウイック！[END]
english: You guys hurry up and turn back to your normal forms too. Don't go looking like HUMANS forever. Uhic!

japanese: [Diablos] ち、もうすぐ交代の時間か、ヒャック。 あー、イヤだ、イヤだ、人間に化けるのは。 ダサイし、くさいし……。[END]
english: [Diablos] Tch, I guess it's almost time for my shift, hyak. Ah, ick, ick, disguising as a human. It's lame and it stinks......

japanese: [Diablos] よし、交代する前にもう一度 魔王様のお姿でも、おがんでくると するかな。ヒャック！[END]
english: [Diablos] Okay, I guess I'll go worship Magus-sama's figure one more time before my shift. Hyak!

japanese: [Naga-ette] こないだ食べた連中、そんなに マズくなかったわよね。
english: [Naga-ette] The ones we ate recently weren't all that nasty.

japanese: とじこめてある、あのふたりの兵士も そのうちに……。 キシシシ……。[END]
english: And sooner or later, those two soldiers we have locked up...... Kee, shi, shi, shi......

japanese: [Hench] ヤクラ様の計画はバッチリだな！ 大臣をつかまえて、自分が大臣に化けるとは いや～、さすがヤクラ様だぜ。
english: [Hench] Yakra-sama's plan is perfect! Capturing the chancellor and disguising himself as the chancellor, oh, I'd except nothing less of Yakra-sama.

japanese: そのおかげで王妃もカンタンに さらってこられたし、いまごろは城の連中 てんてこまいだろうよ。ウヒャヒャ。[END]
english: Thanks to that we kidnapped the queen easy, and I'll bet all them at the castle are going nuts by now. Uhyahya.

japanese: [King] よくぞ、来られた。 ここの主人ヤクラ様も きっとおよろこびになるであろう。
english: [King] Good of you to come. The master here, Yakra-sama, will surely be pleased as well.

japanese: ささ、ヤクラ様がアイサツにみえるまで この部屋でゆっくりと休むがよいぞ。[END]
english: Now then, you should rest in this room until Yakra-sama can see to you.

japanese: [Queen] 私を助けに来てくれたのですね。 しかし、それにはおよびませんよ。
english: [Queen] You came to rescue me. However, that was not necessary.

japanese: ここの主人のヤクラ様は、とてもよい方。 私は、ここにすむことにしました。 さあ、あなた達も楽になさって。[END]
english: The master here, Yakra-sama, is a very good person. I have decided to live here. Now, you make yourselves at home as well.

japanese: [Soldier] も、もしや、リーネ王妃様を 助けに来られた方々では！？
english: [Soldier] C, could it be that you are persons come to rescue the Queen!?

japanese: おお、やはりそうであったか！[END]
english: Oh, so you really were!

japanese: [Demons] そんな、あわてて出ていかなくとも どうぞ、ゆっくりしていってください…… なギャギャギャギャ……！！[END]
english: [Demons] Don't be in such a rush to leave, please, take your time here...... Na, gya, gya, gya, gya......!!

japanese: [Demons] ああ　魔王様～[note] 魔王様～[note] 輝くひとみ　そよぐかみ[note] 山より高く　海より深い[note]
english: [Demons] Ah, Magus-sama~[note] Magus-sama~[note] Shining eyes, wind-blown hair[note] Higher than mountains, deeper than seas[note]

japanese: どんなにはれた、さびしいひるも[note] あなたを思えば、こわくない[note] どんなに明るく、かなしい場所でも[note] あなたがいるなら、へっちゃら　ぷー[note][END]
english: However sunny and lonely the day,[note] If we think of you, we're not afraid[note] However bright and sad the place,[note] If you're there, we're fine   puu[note]

japanese: コーラス　ああ　魔王様ったら[note] 魔王様～[note] われらが　すくいの[note] 魔王様～[note][END]
english: Chorus: Ah, Magus-sama[note] Magus-sama~[note] Our savior[note] Magus-sama~[note]

japanese: [Demons] さあ、お前達も声をあわせて うたうんだよ、お前達自身の とむらいの歌！ ウギャギャッ！！[END]
english: [Demons] Now, you join your voices with us and sing too, the song of your own funeral! Ugya, gyah!!

japanese: [Demons] 待てッ！　クセ者どもめが！！ ゲハゲハ……！[END]
english: [Demons] Wait! You fiends!! pant, wheeze......!

japanese: はりがみ「ここは、通れません。[END]
english: Notice: You cannot pass here.

japanese: はりがみ「行こうと心を決めた者のみが 行ける道がある。[END]
english: Notice: There is a way that only those who have decided their hearts to go can go.

japanese: [Hench] グガー……、ゴガガー……。
english: [Hench] ZzzZz...... zZzzZzzzZz......

japanese: う～ん、いや～ん、バカ。 だから、そこはダミだってばさ……。[END]
english: Uhn, nhoo, silly. I told you, you can't, not there......

japanese: ハアッ！？[END]
english: Haaa!?

japanese: この私の後ろをとるとは……！？ ただ者ではないな、きさまら！[END]
english: How could you have gotten behind me......!? You bastards aren't just anyone!

japanese: [Chancellor] 「かくごはいいかな、リーネ王妃？ この世にさよならをつげる時間だ。[END]
english: [Chancellor] 'I wonder if you're prepared, Queen Leene? It's time to say goodbye to this world.

japanese: 大臣「ほう、お前達……！！ よくここまで、もぐりこめたな。[END]
english: Chancellor: Oh? You......!! You've done well to have been able to slip in this far.

japanese: リーネ「カエル！[END]
english: Leene: Frog!

japanese: カエル「王妃様、お下がりください！ こいつを、かたづけちまいますので。[END]
english: Frog: Your Majesty, please step back! We will take care of this one.

japanese: リーネ「気をつけて……。[END]
english: Leene: Be careful......

japanese: 大臣「ギャハハ……！　ムダ、ムダ！ ここからは誰一人として 生かして帰さぬぞ！[END]
english: Chancellor: Gya, ha, ha......! Useless, useless! I won't let a single one of you leave here alive!

japanese: 大臣「ハッ！　カエルふぜいが……！ きさまらから血まつりだ！！[END]
english: Chancellor: Hah! Worthless frog......! You bastards are making my blood boil!!

japanese: 大臣「だいじーん…… チェーンジッ！！[END]
english: Chancellor: Chancellor...... Change!!

japanese: [System] ヤ～クラ～ッ！！　デロデロン！！[END]
english: [System] Yaaakraaa!! Ta-da!!

japanese: リーネ「やはり、来てくれたのですね。 ありがとう、カエル……。[END]
english: Leene: I knew you would come for me. Thank you, Frog......

japanese: カエル「王が心配しておいでです。 城に戻りましょう。[END]
english: Frog: The King is worried about you. Let us return to the castle.

japanese: カエル「助かったぜ、クロノ。 ルッカ。[END]
english: Frog: Thanks for your help, Crono, Lucca.

japanese: リーネ「ありがとうございました。 あなた方も、どうか共にお城の方へ いらしてください。[END]
english: Leene: Thank you very much. Please come to the castle along with us as well.

japanese: リーネ「ええ。 それでは、お城へもどりましょう。[END]
english: Leene: Yes. Well then, let us return to the castle.

japanese: 本物の大臣「ま、待ってくれ～い！ 本物のわしは、これ、このとーり ぴんぴんしとるぞ！！[END]
english: Real Chancellor: W, wait for meeee! The real me is here, just fine, as you can see!!

japanese: 本物の大臣「ふーっ、助かったわい！ あの化け物め、あんなとこに おしこめおってからに……！[END]
english: Real Chancellor: Phew, I'm saved! That damn monster, shutting me up in a place like that......!

japanese: 大臣「おお、王妃様！？ 本物のわしは、これこのとーり。 ぴんぴんしておりますですじゃ！[END]
english: Chancellor: Oh, the Queen!? The real me is here, as you can see. I am just fine!

japanese: ガルディア王「心配したぞリーネ。[END]
english: King Guardia: I was worried about you, Leene.

japanese: カエル「リーネ様を守りきれず めんぼくしだいもございません。[END]
english: Frog: Unable to protect Leene-sama to the end, I am without honor.

japanese: リーネ「カエル！[END]
english: Leene: Frog!

japanese: 大臣「あのヤクラのヤツめ。 このワシになりかわり リーネ様をさらうなど……
english: Chancellor: That damn Yakra. Replacing me, kidnapping Leene-sama, and all that......

japanese: ああいうやからをキビしくさばくため このガルディア王国にも、裁判所や 刑務所を作らんといけませんな！[END]
english: This Guardia Kingdom must build a courthouse and prison to strictly judge that sort!

japanese: [King] れいを言うぞ、クロノ殿。 しかし、すると裏山で見つかったあの娘は 一体誰なのじゃ……。[END]
english: [King] I thank you, Crono-dono. However, who on earth, then, is the girl who was found in the back hills......?

japanese: リーネ「助けていただき、本当に ありがとうございました。
english: Leene: I truly thank you very much for saving me.

japanese: あと少し、あなたがたの来るのが おそければ、私はどうなっていたか……
english: If you had come a little later, what would have become of me....?

japanese: ところで、私にまちがえられたという 娘は今はどちらに？[END]
english: By the way, where is the girl they say was mistaken for me now?

japanese: ルッカ「そうだわ！ すっかりマールディア姫の事を わすれてたわ！[END]
english: Lucca: That's right! I'd completely forgotten about Princess Marledia!

japanese: ルッカ「ね、クロノ！ マールディア様は、どこで消えた？ もしかしたら、そこに……。[END]
english: Lucca: Hey, Crono! Where did Marledia-sama disappear? Maybe there......

japanese: [Young Woman] やっぱり本物のリーネ様は別の所に いたわけね。 私のすいり通りだったわ。[END]
english: [Young Woman] That means the real Leene-sama was somewhere else after all. It's just like I figured.

japanese: [Young Woman] けど本当にリーネ様そっくりで わたしゃビックリだよ。[END]
english: [Young Woman] But I'm shocked that she really looks just like Leene-sama.

japanese: ルッカ「マールディア王女！[END]
english: Lucca: Princess Marledia!

japanese: マール「あ、あれ？[END]
english: Marle: Wh, wha?

japanese: マール「クロノ！[END]
english: Marle: Crono!

japanese: マール「こわかった……
english: Marle: I was scared......

japanese: いしきがないのに、冷たい所にいるのが わかるの。
english: Even though I'm not conscious, knowing I'm in a cold place.

japanese: 死ぬってああいう感じなのかしら？[END]
english: I wonder if dying feels like that?

japanese: ルッカ「マールディア王女様 ごきげんうるわしゅう……[END]
english: Lucca: Princess Marledia-sama, may you be in good spirits......

japanese: マール「あなたも来てくれてたの！ マールディアって……
english: Marle: You came for me too! Marledia......?

japanese: え！？[END]
english: Huh!?

japanese: マール「バレちゃったみたいね……。[END]
english: Marle: Looks like I've been found out......

japanese: マール「ゴメンね、クロノ。 だますつもりじゃなかったの。[END]
english: Marle: Sorry, Crono. I didn't mean to trick you.

japanese: マール「私はマールディア。 父はガルディア王33世……。
english: Marle: I am Marledia. My father is King Guardia the 33rd......

japanese: けど私だってお祭りを男の子と 見てまわりたかったんだもん。 私が王女だってわかってたら……[END]
english: But even I wanted to wander around and look at the fair with a boy. If you had known that I was a princess......

japanese: マール「クロノは、いっしょに お祭り見てくれなかったでしょ？ はい いいえ[END]
english: Marle: Crono, you wouldn't have seen the festival with me, right? Yes No

japanese: マール「でしょ？ 私は王女様よりマールって いわれる方が好きだもん！[END]
english: Marle: See? And I like being called Marle better than Princess!

japanese: マール「さっすがクロノ！ 私達、友達よね！[END]
english: Marle: That's just like you, Crono! We're friends!

japanese: マール「本物の王妃様も無事に もどったんでしょ？ 私達も帰ろうよ、クロノ！[END]
english: Marle: The real Queen came back safely too, right? Let's go home too, Crono!

japanese: [Knight] ふーむ、見れば見るほどリーネ様に 似ていらっしゃる！[END]
english: [Knight] Hmm, the more I look the more she looks like Leene-sama!

japanese: [Young Woman] あんた達、帰るのかい？ どこまで帰るか知らないけど 気をつけてお行きよ。[END]
english: [Young Woman] You guys going home? I don't know how far you're going, but be careful on your way.

japanese: [Knight] これで騎土団長も対魔王軍にせんねん 出来る。[END]
english: [Knight] Now the Knight Captain can give his undivided attention to opposing Magus's army, too.

japanese: [Chancellor] おお、ほんにリーネ様に生きうつしじゃ！[END]
english: [Chancellor] Oh, you really are like a living copy of Leene-sama!

japanese: [King] おお、無事じゃったか。 たしかに外見はリーネだが、中身はぜんぜん ……
english: [King] Oh, so you were safe. Your appearance is certainly Leene's, but your substance is not at all......

japanese: いや、そなたらには世話になった。 何かあれば国をあげて力になるぞ。[END]
english: Never mind, I am indebted to you all. If something comes up, I will have the country assist you.

japanese: マール「あなたが本物のリーネね！[END]
english: Marle: You must be the real Leene!

japanese: リーネ「まあ、ほんとに私にうりニつ。[END]
english: Leene: My, you really are as like me as two peas in a pod.

japanese: マール「ちゃんと王様と仲良くしないと 私おこっちゃう……
english: Marle: If you don't get along well with the King, I'll get mad......

japanese: 事も出来ないのか。[END]
english: I guess I can't either.

japanese: リーネ「？？[END]
english: Leene: ??

japanese: マール「ううん、とにかく おしあわせにね！[END]
english: Marle: Never mind, anyway, may you live happily ever after!

japanese: [Queen] あなたがたは、何となく他人とは 思えませんわ。[END]
english: [Queen] For some reason or another, I can't think of you as strangers.

japanese: [Knight] お二人がそろわれるのは、ひさしぶりだ。[END]
english: [Knight] It's been a while since those two were both here.

japanese: [Knight] やはり、リーネ様ではなかったか。[END]
english: [Knight] I guess she really wasn't Leene-sama.

japanese: [Knight] リーネ様じゃなかったとはな。[END]
english: [Knight] Never imagined she wasn't Leene-sama.

japanese: [Knight] あのカエル野郎にも、そんな勇気が あったか。[END]
english: [Knight] So that frog bastard had such bravery too.

japanese: [Knight] わからんぞ、スパイと思わせないための 行動かもしれん。[END]
english: [Knight] I dunno, he might have acted so as to seem like he's not a spy.

japanese: [Young Woman] 魔物が大臣様に化けてたなんて…… もっともニセモノの方が品はよかったけど。[END]
english: [Young Woman] A monster turning into the chancellor...... The fake was better quality, though.

japanese: カエル「俺が近くにいたため 王妃様を危険にさらしたのだ……。
english: Frog: The Queen was exposed to danger because I was near......

japanese: 俺は城を出る。[END]
english: I'm leaving the castle.

japanese: マール「キャッ！[END]
english: Marle: Kyah!

japanese: カエル「なるほど、王妃様によく似て おいでだ。[END]
english: Frog: I see, you greatly resemble the Queen.

japanese: カエル「クロノ、お前の太刀すじは なかなか見込みがあったぞ。[END]
english: Frog: Crono, your swordsmanship had considerable promise.

japanese: ルッカ「……
english: Lucca: ......

japanese: カエルも悪くないもんね。[END]
english: You're not bad either, Frog.

japanese: [Soldier] お前はこれから、かおパスだな。[END]
english: [Soldier] You can pass freely from now on.

japanese: [Soldier] ヤクラを倒すなんて、お前ホント ラッキーだな。[END]
english: [Soldier] You're really lucky, beating Yakra.

japanese: [Soldier] これで、王もご安心だ。[END]
english: [Soldier] The King will be relieved too now.

japanese: [Soldier] やはりリーネ様がいると城内が明るいな。[END]
english: [Soldier] The whole castle really is cheery when Leene-sama is here.

japanese: [Knight Captain] そうか、あの修道院に…… カエルのヤツも、りっぱにお役目を はたしたな。
english: [Knight Captain] I see, in that abbey...... That frog guy did a fine job of carrying out his duty too.

japanese: しかし、魔王軍もリーネ様ゆうかいに しっぱいした以上、ほんごしを入れて来る。 こんな時、サイラス様がいれば……。[END]
english: However, now that Magus's army has failed at the abduction of Leene-sama, they're getting serious. If only Cyrus were here in times like these......

japanese: [Soldier] あとは魔王軍をたたくのみ！[END]
english: [Soldier] All that's left is striking Magus's army!

japanese: [Soldier] ヤクラも魔王軍のさしむけた 魔物だったか。[END]
english: [Soldier] So Yakra was a monster Magus's army sent too.

japanese: [Soldier] 修道院が魔物のアジトとはな。[END]
english: [Soldier] Never imagined the abbey was a secret base for the monsters.

japanese: [Soldier] リーネ様ゆうかいも、やはり魔王軍の しわざか。[END]
english: [Soldier] So Leene-sama's abduction was also the doing of Magus's army after all.

japanese: [Woman] 本物のリーネ様が？ こりゃ、ごちそうを作んないとね！[END]
english: [Woman] The real Leene-sama? Gotta make a feast for this!

japanese: [Chef] リーネ様じゃなかっただと？
english: [Chef] You're saying she wasn't Leene-sama?

japanese: なんでえ、せっかくクレープを 作ってみたのに。
english: Damn, and I went to all that trouble trying to make some crepe.

japanese: クッキーとレバーの入ったスープだろ？[END]
english: It's soup with biscuits and liver in it, right?

japanese: [Young Woman] リーネ様なら、ここに来てつまみ食い なんてしないものね。[END]
english: [Young Woman] Leene-sama would never do such a thing as coming here to filch food before meals.

japanese: [Young Woman] リーネ様にしては、よく食べると思った。[END]
english: [Young Woman] I thought she ate a lot for Leene-sama.

japanese: [Soldier] あのカエル野郎、およいで向こうへ わたって行きやがった。[END]
english: [Soldier] That frog bastard swam his way across.

japanese: マール「どこから帰るの？[END]
english: Marle: Where do we go back from?

japanese: ルッカ「おそれながら、マールディア 王女……[END]
english: Lucca: Most humbly, Princess Marledia......

japanese: マール「マールでいいってば！[END]
english: Marle: I'm telling you, Marle's fine!

japanese: ルッカ「で、ではマール……。 ごらん下さい。[END]
english: Lucca: W, well then, Marle...... Please observe.

japanese: マール「キャッ！[END]
english: Marle: Kyah!

japanese: マール「ルッカ、すっごーい！[END]
english: Marle: Lucca, that's aweeesome!

japanese: ルッカ「オホホホ……！[END]
english: Lucca: O, ho, ho, ho......!

japanese: ルッカ「し、失礼しました……！[END]
english: Lucca: Ex, excuse me......!

japanese: マール「話し方もふつうでいーの！ ルッカの方がスゴいんだよ！ 私は王女かもしれないけど、なんにも 出来ないんだから。[END]
english: Marle: Talking normally is fine too! You're more amazing that I am! I might be a princess, but I can't do a thing.

japanese: ルッカ「では、お言葉にあまえて……。[END]
english: Lucca: Then, taking you up on that......

japanese: ルッカ「私は、このひずみに 『ゲート』って名付けたんだけど……[END]
english: Lucca: I named this distortion a "Gate"......

japanese: ゲートは、違う時代の同じ場所に つながっている『門』の様な物なのよ。[END]
english: A Gate is something like a "gateway" that links the same place in different eras.

japanese: 出たり消えたりするのは ゲート自体が不安定だからなの。 そこでテレポッドの原理を応用して この……[END]
english: The Gate itself is unstable when it comes to appearing and disappearing. Accordingly, I applied the principles of the Telepod, and use this......

japanese: ルッカ「ゲートホルダーを使って ゲートを安定させてるってワケ。[END]
english: Lucca: Gate Holder to stabilize the Gate.

japanese: マール「けど何で、このゲートが あの時突然現われたの？[END]
english: Marle: But why did this Gate appear all of a sudden back then?

japanese: ルッカ「テレポッドのえいきょうか あるいはもっと別の何か……[END]
english: Lucca: It could have been the Telepod's effect, or possibly another something......

japanese: マール「何だかムズかしいんだね……。 とにかく帰ろうよ私達の時代へ！[END]
english: Marle: This's kinda complicated...... Anyhow, let's return to our era!

japanese: ルッカ「うん、そうね。 帰りましょ　クロノ！[END]
english: Lucca: Yeah, okay. Let's return, Crono!

japanese: マール「わーい！ やっと帰って来られた！[END]
english: Marle: Yaaay! We finally made it back!

japanese: マール「ね、クロノ、ルッカ！ お城までいっしょに来てくれる？ 色々お世話になっちゃったし！[END]
english: Marle: Hey, Crono, Lucca! Will you come with me to the castle? I owe you one!

japanese: ルッカ「ゴメンなさいねマール。 大変な目にあわせて。[END]
english: Lucca: I'm sorry, Marle. For making you go through all that.

japanese: マール「ううん、スリルあって とっても楽しかったよ！ ステキな友達も出来たし！[END]
english: Marle: Nah, it was thrilling and really fun. I made great friends, for one thing!

japanese: ルッカ「お城へは、クロノ あんたが送りなさいよ。 ちゃ～んとエスコートしてあげるのよ。
english: Lucca: Crono, you see her off to the castle. Do a good job of escorting her.

japanese: 私はゲートの出てきた原因を 調べてみるわ。[END]
english: I'll try investigating the cause of the Gate's appearance.

japanese: マール「またねー　ルッカ！[END]
english: Marle: Later, Lucca!

japanese: マール「じゃ、お城までエスコートして クロノ！[END]
english: Marle: Well then, escort me to the castle, Crono!

japanese: [Young Woman] 王女様がお城をぬけ出したそうよ。[END]
english: [Young Woman] I hear the Princess slipped out of the castle.

japanese: [Man] 広場の商人は新商品の しいれのためみんな家に帰ったよ。 町のグッズマーケットによってみな。[END]
english: [Man] The merchants in the square have all gone home to stock up on new merchandise. Try going to the town goods market.

japanese: ジナ「お帰り、クロノ。[END]
english: Jina: Welcome home, Crono.

japanese: [Young Woman] ねえ、知ってる？ なんでも昔は、西の森に修道院が たっていたことがあったんだって。
english: [Young Woman] Hey, did you know? I hear that an abbey was built in the western forest long ago.

japanese: でも、どうしてなくなって しまったのかしらね……。[END]
english: But I wonder why it's gone now......?

japanese: [Young Man] ははっ、年がいもなく シルバーポイントをためるのに 夢中になっちまったよ。[END]
english: [Young Man] Ha, ha, I'm getting caught up in collecting silver points despite my age.

japanese: [Man] 今日もエレインさんは船つき場か。 フリッツのやつ……。 本当に、どこいっちまったんだ……[END]
english: [Man] Elaine-san is at the pier again today? That Fritz...... Just where has he gone......?

japanese: [Man] あっ！ いらっしゃいませ なんのご用でしょうか？[END]
english: [Man] Ah! Welcome. What did you want?

japanese: お金がたりません。[END]
english: You don't have enough money.

japanese: まいど、ありがとうございました。[END]
english: Thank you, and come again.

japanese: ララ「ルッカもタバンも発明で いそがしくて。[END]
english: Lara: Lucca and Taban are both busy with inventions.

japanese: ルッカ「うーん…… 2本足で完全なバランスをとって あるくロボットの小型化は やはりむずかしい。
english: Lucca: Hmmm...... The miniaturization of robots that balance perfectly on two legs and walk really is difficult.

japanese: あ！　クロノ！　早く王女を お城までつれていってやりなよ。[END]
english: Ah! Crono! Hurry up and take the princess to the castle.

japanese: タバン「ほら、これが今日のかせぎで 手に入れたリンゴだ。[END]
english: Taban: Look, I got these apples with what we earned today.

japanese: ララ「いつもすまないね。[END]
english: Lara: Thanks for always.

japanese: [Chancellor] 「マールディア様～！[END]
english: [Chancellor] Marledia-samaaa!

japanese: 大臣「ご無事でしたか？ 一体、今までどこに！？
english: Chancellor: You're safe? Where on earth have you BEEN!?

japanese: 何者かにさらわれたという情報もあり 兵士達に国中を探させていたのですぞ！[END]
english: There were even reports that you were kidnapped by someone, and we had the soldiers searching all over the country!

japanese: 大臣「ム！　そこのムサいヤツ！ そうか、お前だなッ！？ マールディア様をさらったのは！[END]
english: Chancellor: Hey! You scum there! That's it, it's you, isn't it!? The one who kidnapped Marledia-sama!

japanese: マール「違うよ！　クロノは……[END]
english: Marle: You're wrong! Crono......

japanese: 大臣「えーい！　ひっとらえろ！ マールディア様をまどわせ 王家転ぷくをくわだてる テロリストめッ！！[END]
english: Chancellor: Hey! Arrest him! You damn terrorist, misleading Marledia-sama and plotting to overthrow the royal family!!

japanese: マール「や、やめてーッ！[END]
english: Marle: S, stop it!

japanese: マール「やめなさ～いッ！！[END]
english: Marle: Stoooop!!

japanese: 大臣「な、何をしておる！[END]
english: Chancellor: Wh, what are you doing!

japanese: 兵士「しかしマールディア様が……[END]
english: Soldier: But Marledia-sama......

japanese: 大臣「かまわ～ん！　ひっとらえ～いッ！！[END]
english: Chancellor: I don't caaare! Arrest him!!

japanese: マール「クロノーッ！！[END]
english: Marle: Cronoooo!!

japanese: [Pierre] 私がベンゴシのピエールです。[END]
english: [Pierre] I am the lawyer Pierre.

japanese: [Chancellor] 私がケンジの大臣じゃ！[END]
english: [Chancellor] I'm the the public prosecutor, the Chancellor!

japanese: 大臣「ようこそみなさん。
english: Chancellor: Welcome, everyone.

japanese: マールディア王女ゆうかいの罪で うたがわれているクロノという 男をここに連れてまいりましょう。[END]
english: Let us bring in the man called Crono, who is suspected in the crime of kidnapping Princess Marledia.

japanese: 大臣「この男をどうしましょう… 火あぶり？　くすぐりのけい？ さかさづり？
english: Chancellor: What shall we do with this man... Burning at the stake? The tickling sentence? Hanging upside-down?

japanese: それとも……ギロチンでクビを……。[END]
english: Or...... his neck with a guillotine......

japanese: 大臣「それを決めるのはみなさんです。 さ、始めましょう。[END]
english: Chancellor: It will be all of you who decide that. Now, let us begin.

japanese: 裁判長「では、ヒコク人クロノ！ 証言だいにつきなさい。[END]
english: Presiding Judge: Well then, defendant Crono! Take the witness stand.

japanese: ピエール「まずは私からいきましょう。 クロノに本当にゆうかいの いしがあったのか？　……いや無い。[END]
english: Pierre: I will begin. Did Crono truly have the intent to kidnap? ......no, he didn't.

japanese: ピエール「ケンジがわはヒコクが計画的に 王女をさらったと言いますが そうでしょうか？　……いやちがう。
english: Pierre: The prosecution says the defendant deliberately kidnapped the princess, but is that the case? ......no, it's wrong.

japanese: 2人はぐうぜん出会ったのであって 決して故意ではありません。[END]
english: The two met by chance, and it was by no means intentional.

japanese: 大臣「はたしてそうでしょうか？ どっちがきっかけをつくりましたか？ 私です。 マールです。[END]
english: Chancellor: Is that really so? Which of you made the first move? I did. Marle did.

japanese: 大臣「よろしい！ 聞いての通りぐうぜんをよそおって ヒコクは王女に近づきました。[END]
english: Chancellor: Good! As you have heard, feigning chance, the defendant approached the princess.

japanese: 大臣「本当にそう言い切れますか？ あなたからぶつかったという目撃者が いるのです。[END]
english: Chancellor: Can you really say that with certainty? There are witnesses who say it was you who collided with her.

japanese: 大臣「そして王女はさそわれるまま ルッカ親子のショーへ 足を運びます。 その姿は何人もの人が目撃して います。 そして2人は姿を消した……。 これがゆうかいじゃなくして 一体何でしょう？[END]
english: Chancellor: Then, with the princess invited, he proceeds to Lucca and her father's show. Many people are witnesses to that. And then, the two disappeared...... If this isn't kidnapping, then what on earth is it?

japanese: 大臣「ヒコクの人間性が うたがわれる事実も私はいくつか つかんでいます。[END]
english: Chancellor: I have even gotten hold of several facts that place the defendant's humanity in question.

japanese: ピエール「異議あり！
english: Pierre: Objection!

japanese: それは今回のけんにかんけいあるので しょうか？　……いや無い。[END]
english: Does this have any relevance to the current case? ......no, it doesn't.

japanese: 裁判長「かんけいあるのかね？　大臣。[END]
english: Presiding Judge: Is there relevance? Chancellor.

japanese: 大臣「はい。　証言の正しさを しめすためにもヒコクの人間性を 知らせておく必要があります。
english: Chancellor: Yes. There is a need to make known the defendant's humanity in order to show his testimony's accuracy.

japanese: ピエール「いいでしょう。[END]
english: Pierre: Fine.

japanese: ピエール「では 証人を連れて来ましょう。 ヒコクのせいじつさを 証明するかわいい証人を。[END]
english: Pierre: Well then, we shall bring in a witness. A charming witness who will verify the defendant's honesty.

japanese: [Little Girl] この人はね…… わたちのネコちゃんを連れて来て くれたの。[END]
english: [Little Girl] This person...... He brought me my kitty.

japanese: あの時はありがとうね。[END]
english: Thanks for back then.

japanese: ピエール「どうです？ このわか者の行動は？ くんしょうものですよ。[END]
english: Pierre: How is it? This young person's conduct? Worthy of a medal.

japanese: ピエール「くく…… きいてるみたいよんっ。[END]
english: Pierre: Heh heh...... Looks like it's working.

japanese: 大臣「ヒコクのれいこくなせいかくは 明白なものであります。[END]
english: Chancellor: The defendant's coldhearted character is obvious.

japanese: 大臣「身におぼえがあるだろう？ ネコちゃんを見失ったいたいけな少女の たのみも聞けないお前は……[END]
english: Chancellor: You do remember doing this? You wouldn't even listen to the request of an innocent girl who had lost sight of her cat.

japanese: [Little Girl] わたちの事ムシしたでしょ。[END]
english: [Little Girl] You ignored me.

japanese: 大臣「おお……、かわいそうに…… どうもありがとう。[END]
english: Chancellor: Oh...... you poor thing...... Thank you.

japanese: 大臣「もう何の説明もいりますまい。[END]
english: Chancellor: No further explanation is required.

japanese: 大臣「あなたは盗みをはたらいた事は？ あります。 決してありません。[END]
english: Chancellor: Have you ever committed theft? I have. I certainly have not.

japanese: 大臣「ほら、この通り。 ヒコクはモラルにかけております。 それは自他共にみとめる事なのです。 聞いてください。　ひつうなさけびを！[END]
english: Chancellor: Look, as he says. The defendant is lacking in morals. That is generally accepted. Please listen. It's a bitter outcry!

japanese: 大臣「とぼけるのはいけません。 証人がいるのです。[END]
english: Chancellor: Do not play dumb.

japanese: [Old Man] オラが大事にしてた、べんとうさァ コイツが食べてしまっただ。 母ちゃんがいっしょうけんめい 作ってくれたべんとうだべ！[END]
english: [Old Man] My precious lunch! He ate it. The lunch mommy worked so hard to make me!

japanese: 大臣「まじめにくらしている人の わずかな楽しみをもうばいさるヒコクに 同情のよちはありますまい。[END]
english: Chancellor: There is no room for sympathy for a defendant who would even deprive an honestly living man of his faint pleasures.

japanese: ピエール「もんだいは動機です。 この一市民にマールディア王女を ゆうかいする動機がどこに ありましょう？　……いや無い。[END]
english: Pierre: The problem is motive. Where is the motive for this citizen to kidnap Princess Marledia? ......no, there is none.

japanese: 大臣「お言葉を返すようで悪いが ざいさん目当てと言うのはどうかな クロノ君？
english: Chancellor: Sorry to contradict you, but what if I say your purpose is her wealth, Crono-kun?

japanese: 王女のざいさんに 目がくらんだのだね？ いいえ はい[END]
english: You had your eyes on the princess's wealth, didn't you? No Yes

japanese: 大臣「すなおにはいたようだね。[END]
english: Chancellor: It seems he's spoken frankly.

japanese: 大臣「もうあえて私から言う事も ないでしょう。 裁判長。　判決を。[END]
english: Chancellor: I have nothing more to say. Your honor. The verdict.

japanese: 大臣「本当にざいさんには きょうみが無いのかね？ きょうみない すこしだけ[END]
english: Chancellor: Do you truly have no interest in her wealth? No interest Just a little

japanese: 大臣「ま、まあいいでしょう。 私のじんもんは終わります。
english: Chancellor: W, well all right. My questioning concludes.

japanese: ピエール「見ての通り正ぎ感の強い 少年です。　さあ裁判長。 判決を。[END]
english: Pierre: As you can see, he is a young man with a strong sense of justice. Now, your honor. The verdict.

japanese: 大臣「みなさん、今の言葉をしっかりと 頭に入れておいて下さい。 ヒコクはざいさんにはきょうみ無いと 言いました。
english: Chancellor: Everyone, please keep his words just now firmly in mind. The defendant said he has no interest in her wealth.

japanese: では証人を。[END]
english: Now for the witness.

japanese: [Young Woman] やーね、私見ましたのよ。[END]
english: [Young Woman] Uh-huhn, I saw it.

japanese: あらま！ 何か私きんちょうしてきちゃったわ！[END]
english: Wow! I'm so nervous!

japanese: [Young Woman] その人、王女様とぶつかって転んだ時に まっ先にペンダントをひろいに行ったわ。 王女様を気づかうよりも先に……。[END]
english: [Young Woman] When this person ran into the Princess and they fell over, he went straight to grab up her pendant. Even before worrying about the Princess......

japanese: 王女様にペンダントを返すのを こばんだりしてたみたい……。[END]
english: It looked like he was refusing to give the Princess back her pendant......

japanese: [Young Woman] ボッシュって物売りに、売り飛ばそうと していたのよ。[END]
english: [Young Woman] He tried selling it off to this peddler, Bosch.

japanese: 大臣「最後に決定的な証言をして しめくくってもらいましょう。[END]
english: Chancellor: Finally, let us bring this to a finish with some conclusive testimony.

japanese: [Young Woman] 私は聞いたのよ！！ 王女様が言った言葉をこのみみで はっきりと！[END]
english: [Young Woman] I heard her! What the Princess said, plain as day, with my own ears!

japanese: あら、もう終わり？ やーね。[END]
english: Oh, done already? Uh-huhn.

japanese: 裁判長「ばいしんいん達よ。 有罪と思う者は左へ 無罪だと思う者は右へ行きなさい！[END]
english: Presiding Judge: Jurors. Go, those who think he is guilty to the left, those who think he is not guilty to the right!

japanese: [Juror] 有罪[END]
english: [Juror] Guilty.

japanese: [Juror] 無罪[END]
english: [Juror] Not guilty.

japanese: [Presiding Judge] せいしゅくに！　せいしゅくに！[END]
english: [Presiding Judge] Silence! Silence!

japanese: 判決が出た！[END]
english: A verdict has been reached!

japanese: ぜんいんいっち！！[END]
english: Unanimously!!

japanese: 有罪とする。 ただちにどくぼうへ。 3日後には死刑をしっこうする！[END]
english: We find him guilty. Take him to solitary confinement at once. We will enforce the death sentence in three days!

japanese: [Presiding Judge] 無罪とする！！
english: [Presiding Judge] We find him not guilty!

japanese: ……しかしだ。　ゆうかいのいしは なかったにせよ、マールディア王女を しばらく連れ出したのは事実。
english: ......however. Though he had no intent to kidnap, it is a fact that he took Princess Marledia away with him for a while.

japanese: よってはんせいをうながすため3日間の どくぼう入りを命ず！！[END]
english: Accordingly, to urge him to contemplation, we sentence him to three days of solitary confinement!!

japanese: 大臣「さ、連れていけ！[END]
english: Chancellor: Now, take him away!

japanese: マール「待って！！
english: Marle: Wait!!

japanese: 大臣「お、王女様……[END]
english: Chancellor: P, Princess......

japanese: ガルディア王「いいかげんにしなさい！ マールディア！[END]
english: King Guardia: Behave yourself! Marledia!

japanese: マール「父上！　聞いてください！
english: Marle: Father! Please listen!

english: King Guardia: I simply want you to behave like a proper princess in the castle. Even if you are, for example, a king or princess, you must abide by the country's rules… Leave the rest to the Chancellor. Marledia, you forget about what happened in the town, too.

japanese: ガルディア王「さ、いくぞ！[END]
english: King Guardia: Now, we're going!

japanese: マール「クロノーーー！！[END]
english: Marle: Cronoooooo!!

english: Chancellor: This guy's the terrorist who planned to overthrow the royal family.

japanese: 大臣「裁判で有罪となったので 引きわたしに来た。[END]
english: Chancellor: Because he was found guilty in trial, we came to hand him over.

japanese: 所長「こやつが王女さまをゆうかいした テロリストですか。[END]
english: Warden: So this guy's the terrorist who kidnapped the Princess-sama.

english: Chancellor: His execution's in three days. Keep watch so you won't let him escape.

japanese: 所長「しょうちいたしました。[END]

english: Warden: Execution? I've heard nothing about any such thing......

japanese: 大臣「気にするな。 手続きのしょるいが おくれているだけだ。 それとも、わしの言葉が信じられぬか？[END]
english: Chancellor: Never mind that. It's just that the paperwork's delayed. Or, can you not believe my word?

japanese: 所長「め、めっそうもない！[END]
english: Warden: Th, that is surely not the case!

japanese: 所長「えいへい！[END]
english: Warden: Guards!

japanese: 所長「こいつをつれてゆけ！[END]
english: Warden: Take him away!

english: [System] [value8] day(s) left until the day of the execution......

english: [System] HP and MP recovered!

japanese: [System] エーテルを手に入れた！[END]
english: [System] Got Ether(s)!

english: [Omnicrone] I, I can't take this.

english: [Fritz] H, help me!

english: [System] Help him? Yes No

english: An ability is installed in the Dragon Tank's head that recovers the damage the body takes.

japanese: この頭には天、火ぞくせいの技を防ぐ シールドが装備されていますので 剣やピストルによる攻撃でしか ダメージをあたえる事が出来ません。
english: A shield that defends against Sky and Fire fire attribute skills is equipped to the head, so one cannot inflict damage except with attacks by weapons like swords or pistols.

japanese: つまり、剣などの攻撃で頭を壊されない限り ドラゴンせんしゃがたおされる事は ないと考えてよいでしょう。 ガルディア王国開発部より[END]
english: In other words, as long as the head is not broken by the attacks of swords, etc., you may consider the Dragon Tank unbeatable. From the Guardia Kingdom Development Dept.

japanese: ルッカ「何の音かしら？[END]
english: Lucca: I wonder what the noise is?

japanese: 大臣「ド、ドラゴンせんしゃが！！ 修理するんだー！！[END]

japanese: 大臣「き、きさまら、おぼえておれよ！[END]

english: [Soldier] 'It's an escaaape!

english: Lucca: This place is trouble!

english: Soldier: No, that is surely not the case!

japanese: [Chancellor] 「そこまでじゃ～ッ！[END]
english: [Chancellor] 'That's as far as you're going!

english: Chancellor: Hey, bow down! King Guardia the 33rd is cominnnng!  Marle: Father......

japanese: 王「マールディア！[END]
english: King: Marledia!

japanese: 大臣「マールディア様！[END]
english: Chancellor: Marledia-sama!

japanese: マール「行こう！　クロノ！！[END]
english: Marle: Let's go, Crono!!

japanese: 大臣「何をしておる！ 追えッ！　追え～いッ！！[END]
english: Chancellor: What are you doing! After them! After themmm!!

japanese: 王「マールディア……。[END]

japanese: マール「それでもいい！ 私のためにクロノが つかまっちゃうこの時代よりは！[END]
english: Marle: It's fine anyway! Better than this era where Crono was arrested because of me!

japanese: 大臣「マールディア様～！[END]
english: Chancellor: Marledia-samaaa!

japanese: ルッカ「えーい、もうどうとでも なれだわ！[END]
english: Lucca: Eey, I'm even getting used to acting without thinking it over!

english: Marle: No way can even the chancellor come chasing us this far.

japanese: マール「けど、ここ……どこ？[END]

japanese: [System] 不思議な紋章がきざまれている。 何かの力によって封印されているようだ。[END]
english: [System] A mysterious crest is inscribed. It seems to be sealed by some power.

japanese: [Man] これを見てると、不思議と生きようって気が してくる……。[END]

japanese: あそこに出るゆうれいにゃ、剣やガンなどの 物理攻撃はききやしねえ……。[END]
english: Physical attacks like swords and guns don't work on the phantoms that show up there......

english: [Man] This's the EnerBox. You can get a good sound sleep in hardly any time, but your stomach ain't satisfied......

japanese: ひやかしに用はねーよ。[END]

english: [System] 500G was stolen!

english: Old Man: I'm Don, excuse me for not saying so sooner. I'm descended from the one-time director of the information center here.

english: In the basement here, we've even got things like a super computer and storage for foodstuffs.

japanese: しかし、けいびロボットが、いまだに 動いていて近づけないのじゃ。 ひにくなモンじゃよ……。[END]

japanese: [Child] だれ？　お兄ちゃん達……。[END]

english: [Woman] My husband headed for the food stores......

japanese: それっきりなんです……。[END]
english: That's the last we heard of him......

english: [Child] Dad's gonna come back with food soon. [Man] But there's something weird about you...... Did you really come from the western dome......? Yes No

english: HP and MP recovered!
